alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 9:35PM EDT until April 21 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn affecting Marquette County. .High water along the East Branch of the Escanaba River at Gwinn due to recent rain and snow melt is still ongoing. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Escanaba River at Gwinn. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Peter Nordeen park on right bank floods * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:57 PM EDT Monday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:57 PM EDT Monday was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Thursday morning and continue falling to 3.9 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 04/21/1985. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday afternoon at 145 PM EDT.
